<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 243, 318]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
October/November 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 216, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 696, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) travels in the positive direction along a straight line with constant acceleration. \(P\) travels a distance of \(52 \text{m}\) during the 2nd second of its motion and a distance of \(64 \text{m}\) during the 4th second of its motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 537, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the initial speed and the acceleration of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Particles \(X\) and \(Y\) move in a straight line through points \(A\) and \(B\). Particle \(X\) starts from rest at \(A\) and moves towards \(B\). At the same instant, \(Y\) starts from rest at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 510, 139]]<|/det|>
At time \(t\) seconds after the particles start moving

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 141, 747, 161]]<|/det|>
* the acceleration of \(X\) in the direction \(AB\) is given by \((12t + 12) \text{ m s}^{-2}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 163, 737, 183]]<|/det|>
* the acceleration of \(Y\) in the direction \(AB\) is given by \((24t - 8) \text{ m s}^{-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 199, 146, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 198, 702, 217]]<|/det|>
It is given that the velocities of \(X\) and \(Y\) are equal when they collide.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 230, 371, 248]]<|/det|>
Calculate the distance \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 231, 920, 248]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 439, 148, 456]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 439, 920, 490]]<|/det|>
The car and caravan now travel up a straight hill, inclined at an angle \(\sin^{-1} 0.14\) to the horizontal, at a constant speed of \(v \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\). The car's engine is working at \(31 \mathrm{kW}\). The resistances to the motion of the car and caravan are unchanged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 502, 218, 520]]<|/det|>
Find \(v\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 502, 920, 520]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 82, 695, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 297, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
Particles of masses \(1.5\mathrm{kg}\) and \(3\mathrm{kg}\) lie on a plane which is inclined at an angle of \(\alpha\) to the horizontal, where \(\tan \alpha = \frac{3}{4}\). The section of the plane from \(A\) to \(B\) is smooth and the section of the plane from \(B\) to \(C\) is rough. The \(1.5\mathrm{kg}\) particle is held at rest at \(A\) and the \(3\mathrm{kg}\) particle is in limiting equilibrium at \(B\). The distance \(AB\) is \(x\mathrm{m}\) and the distance \(BC\) is \(4\mathrm{m}\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 146, 393]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 375, 813, 394]]<|/det|>
Show that the coefficient of friction between the particle at \(B\) and the plane is 0.75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 376, 920, 395]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
The \(1.5 \mathrm{kg}\) particle is released from rest. In the subsequent motion the two particles collide and coalesce. The time taken for the combined particle to travel from \(B\) to \(C\) is \(2 \mathrm{s}\). The coefficient of friction between the combined particle and the plane is still \(0.75\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 148, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 218, 153]]<|/det|>
Find \(x\).
